lead_paragraph: The Union fired Peter Nowak in 2012 after getting complaints that he hazed rookie players by spanking them so hard it hurt his hand, according to newly filed court documents.

headline.main: New Details in Philadelphia Union Coach’s Firing

abstract: Newly released court documents accuse former Philadelphia Union coach Peter Nowak of hazing rookie players by spanking them and directing them to run 10 miles under poor conditions; Novak is trying to persuade federal court to overturn April 2015 ruling that upheld his dismissal from team and ordered him to pay team's legal fees; other soccer news noted.
